Garlic and Oyster Fried Rice
--------------------------------------
Ingredients (Safe): 

 - 2 cups uncooked long grain white or brown rice
 - 4 oz fresh minced gingerroot
 - 3 small garlic cloves, finely chopped
 - 1 tbsp soy sauce
 - ½ tsp salt
 - ¼ cup canola oil
 - Fresh green onions for garnish
  * Optional substitutes for milk include almond, coconut, oat or cashew milks; use 1/4 cup per person if using dairy alternatives instead of regular cow's milk.*
 *Optional Substitutes for Eggs Include tofu scrambled blocks made into bite size cubes by pressing out water then sautéing them until they're golden yellow but not crispy around edges... Use about half a block for each serving you make! Add at least one tablespoon blackstrap molasses before frying so it adds some sweetness back into your dish without having sugar added directly onto foods like pancakes where we often do this naturally anyway.*
 *To replace Fish Sauce try combining equal parts of Soy Sauce + Hoisin Sauce OR Dijon Mustard+Tamari Glaze + A dash Worcestershire & Tabasco.. Each will lend their own unique flavours when mixed together properly! Be creative and experiment different combinations yourself too?!
